pr_title: Fix upgrade tests with and without snapshot

timeline.bodyText: You said that volumes are "properly managed by Testcontainers by adding the right labels". Is this what you meant? I tried googling a bit on how it works but didn't find much
timeline.author: MiguelPires

replies.bodyText:
Yes, this is undocumented unfortunately, but Sergei is the one who told me to use this. I imagine one downside is it's a little brittle if they ever change how Ryuk works, but I think that's a small thing. Of course it would be nice if Testcontainers already provided the feature, and maybe that's something I'll contribute at some point so we have an official, maintained API on how to do this.
To explain a little, my understanding is that the Ryuk container will watch Docker resources with those labels, and reap them afterwards in case our process dies or doesn't clean them up. So any resource with those labels will get cleaned up eventually.
replies.author: npepinpe

timeline.author: MiguelPires

replies.bodyText: Hm, I think that's just a fundamental problem with a generic structure like Either =/ I admit in this case I'd rather have something like Rust's Result type, where you would then write something like isOk() (since it's either OK or failed, which is really what I use it as for the client). At the same time, I didn't feel like introducing a new type in this PR (though imo it would be a good type to have in general 🙂)
replies.author: npepinpe

replies.bodyText: I added a description to the assert via as() for better error message 👍
replies.author: npepinpe

timeline.message:
chore(test-util): add new utilities

- adds a new AssertJ assertion for Either
- adds a new Testcontainers utility to create volumes which get cleaned
  up even if the process crashes

chore(upgrade-tests): fixes tests using snapshots

- rewrites tests for junit5
- improve assertion to check for snapshots
- introduces actuator client
- use named Docker volumes instead of shared folder

chore(upgrade-tests): fixes tests using snapshots

- rewrites tests for junit5
- improve assertion to check for snapshots
- introduces actuator client
- use named Docker volumes instead of shared folder
